div1.fw: MILDRED R. BENNETT 329 North Cedar RED CLOUD, NEBRASKA 68970
div1.p: Thank you so much for your good letter. I am delighted about BLACK ELK SPEAKS. It is such good reading and it is wonderful to know that young people are reading it. Doesn't that fact make you feel good? I wonder what the movies can do with it. They will make something, I'm sure. Of course, it will end up on television. It's good to know that someone is having a good influence on the youth of today. They need hope and courage and all the things you can give them.
I'm so glad that two more of your books will be out in September and October. We sell quite a few here at the Memorial and everyonce in a while have inquiries about you.
I hope the autobiography is going well. I know it is if you keep your health. And I will be eager to see the biography at long last. Will the U. of N. Press print it?

You didn't say if you were aware of Jack London's use of your "Let me live out my life" in his MARTIN EDEN. I was much astonished to find it there in the beginning of the book without credit to you. Did you know Jack London?

We keep busy here at the Memorial. Now is the season when many school are taking tours. We have about five this week. We have the depot practically finished, except for landscaping and furnishing the caretaker's apartment. We have spent our $20,000 and accomplished just about what we set out to do.
The doctor is very busy as usual. Yesterday he spent digging in his garden. He loves the outdoors.

Bill will graduate from Medical School on June 7. His wife will graduate from the University of Nebraska at Omaha on May 30. We plan to attend both graduations, but I suppose will be able to go only for the day.

Perhaps we can have a visit this summer. I hope so. I am going to Europe July 14-Aug. 4 to visit Bavaria, Switzerland and Austria, and attend the Passion Play. Mrs. Sherwood gave me a thousand dollars and/asked me to see the Passion Play. She was there in 1930.
This brings love from all of us. Take care of yourself.
